qas.question: Who was the British Prime Minister in 1982?
Which treaty had given Hong Kong to Britain?
When did Britain hand over Hong Kong to China?
When was the Sino-British Joint Declaration?
Which territory did Margaret Thatcher compare Hong Kong to?

context: In September 1982, Prime minister <a0_0>Margaret Thatcher<a0_0/> travelled to Beijing to negotiate with the Chinese government on the future of Britain's last major and most populous overseas territory, Hong Kong. Under the terms of the 1842 <a1_0>Treaty of Nanking<a1_0/>, Hong Kong Island itself had been ceded to Britain in perpetuity, but the vast majority of the colony was constituted by the New Territories, which had been acquired under a 99-year lease in 1898, due to expire in 1997. Thatcher, seeing parallels with the <a4_0>Falkland Islands<a4_0/>, initially wished to hold Hong Kong and proposed British administration with Chinese sovereignty, though this was rejected by China. A deal was reached in <a3_0>1984<a3_0/>—under the terms of the Sino-British Joint Declaration, Hong Kong would become a special administrative region of the People's Republic of China, maintaining its way of life for at least 50 years. The handover ceremony in <a2_0>1997<a2_0/> marked for many, including Charles, Prince of Wales, who was in attendance, "the end of Empire".
